title: Cafetière
description: A French press, also known as a press pot, coffee press, coffee plunger, cafetière (UK) or cafetière à piston, is a basic coffee, simple to made.

title: Frappuccino
description: The frappuccino is a coffee blended with ice and other ingredients and topped with whip cream.

title: Caramel Macchiato
description: This refreshing and tasty iced coffee drink is yet another our classic, and just like the frappuccino, the caramel macchiato.

title: Café Mocha
description: This variant of the café latte is an American invention, one inspired by the coffee beverage Bicerin. The café mocha is an espresso-based drink with hot milk and chocolate.

title: Caffé Americano
description: Many espresso-based drinks use milk, but not the café Americano – or simply 'Americano'. The drink also uses espresso but is infused with hot water instead of milk. The result is a coffee beverage that has the same strength of drip coffee but with a different flavor.

title: Turkish Coffee
description: Turkish coffee boasts an unrivaled taste, body, and aroma – prepared and presented in time-honored Turkish tradition.

title: Cafe Cubano
description: The café cubano – also known as Cuban coffee or Cuban espresso – is a type of espresso that originated from Cuba. This espresso shot is sweetened after brewing and is used as a base for other drinks. Its strength is twice that of traditional American coffee and Cubans drink it as part of their daily morning ritual.

title: Café Latte
description: Cafe latte is made from espresso (one-third), steam milk (two-thirds), topped with about a centimeter of foam. It’s one of the most popular coffee beverages around.

title: Irish Coffee
description: A cocktail made of hot coffee, sugar, thick cream, and of course, Irish whiskey.

title: Espresso
description: This coffee beverage is made by forcing nearly boiling water under pressure through ground coffee beans, resulting in a brew that’s thicker than those made from other brewing methods.

title: Cortado
description: The cortado is a favorite in Spain, Portugal, and Latin America, often enjoyed as an afternoon drink. The beverage uses espresso that is cut by a small amount of warm milk, reducing its acidity.The milk used for the cortado is a little cooler than that of the macchiato while having the consistency of the milk used in latte. If you cannot decide between iced and hot coffee, pick the cortado for a change.

title: Affogato
description: It’s hard to decide whether the affogato is a beverage or a dessert, but that hardly matters. You must try this concoction if you haven’t yet. This coffee-based beverage uses the hot and bitter espresso to melt the gelato, resulting to a creamy pool of coffee and ice cream that you’d want to drown in!

title: Cappuccino
description: This Italian coffee drink is traditionally made with espresso, hot milk, and topped with foamed milk, often prepared with a milk steamer for a thicker froth.

title: Plain Coffee
description: Plain coffee is special. It’s one of the most traded commodities in the world, second only to oil!. Simple combination of water and coffee.

title: Iced Coffee
description: Iced coffee can be a great, refreshing beverage – but only if you can keep the drink cold without diluting it with ice.

title: Café au lait
description: Café au lait – half brewed coffee, half warm milk, 100% French. The beverage’s name literally translates to “coffee with milk,” very apt as one of its essential components is the thinning of the strong coffee with warm creamy milk.
